Original Text: Malden Mills workers accept contract A union representing about 700 textile workers at Malden Mills Industries Inc. voted to accept a contract offer, averting a possible strike. Paul Coorey, president of the Union of Needletrades, Industrial and Textile Employees Union, Local 311, said workers voted 301-136 to accept a three-year pact that included annual wage increases of 2 percent, 2 percent, and 3 percent. But ...
Translation: Los trabajadores de Malden Mills aceptan el contrato. Un sindicato que representa a unos 700 trabajadores textiles en Malden Mills Industries Inc. votó para aceptar una oferta de contrato, evitando una posible huelga. Paul Coorey, presidente de la Unión de Trabajadores de la Industria Textil y de la Aguja, Sindicato Local 311, dijo que los trabajadores votaron 301-136 para aceptar un pacto de tres años que incluía aumentos salariales anuales del 2 por ciento, 2 por ciento y 3 por ciento. Pero ...
Paraphrase 1: 1. The Union of Needletrades, Industrial and Textile Employees Union, Local 311, revealed their decision to accept a three-year contract offer proposed by Malden Mills Industries Inc. to approximately 700 unionized textile workers. Union president, Paul Coorey, mentioned a voting outcome of 301-136 favoring the acceptance of the contract which underpins annual wage increments of 2%, 2%, and 3% respectively for its duration, preventing an impending strike.
Paraphrase 2: 2. To ward off a projected strike, about 700 Malden Mills Industries Inc. textile workers, represented by the Union of Needletrades, Industrial and Textile Employees Union, Local 311, consented to a contract offer. This three-year agreement, approved by a 301-136 vote, guarantees yearly pay rises of 2%, 2%, and 3% as disclosed by the Union president, Paul Coorey.

Original Text: P-to-P partner charges RIAA with patent infringement NEW YORK - The litigious Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA) is involved in another legal dispute with a P-to-P (peer-to-peer) technology maker, but this time, the RIAA is on defense. Altnet Inc. filed a lawsuit Wednesday accusing the RIAA and several of its partners of infringing an Altnet patent covering technology for identifying requested files on a P-to-P network.
Translation: Socio P-to-P acusa a la RIAA de violar una patente NUEVA YORK - La conflictiva Asociación de la Industria de Grabación de América (RIAA, por sus siglas en inglés) está involucrada en otra disputa legal con un fabricante de tecnología P-to-P (peer-to-peer), pero esta vez, la RIAA está a la defensiva. Altnet Inc. presentó una demanda el miércoles acusando a la RIAA y a varios de sus socios de infringir una patente de Altnet que cubre la tecnología para identificar archivos solicitados en una red P-to-P.
Paraphrase 1: In New York, Altnet Inc., a peer-to-peer (P-to-P) technology maker, is accusing the typically litigious Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA) and its affiliates of patent infringement. In a change of pace, the RIAA finds itself in a defensive position in this latest legal altercation. Altnet is arguing that the RIAA has been using technology patented by the company to identify requested files on a P-to-P network.
Paraphrase 2: The Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA), known for its numerous legal battles, now stands accused by P-to-P (peer-to-peer) technology company Altnet Inc. of patent infringement. This time, however, the RIAA is the one on the receiving end of the lawsuit. Altnet has filed a lawsuit that claims the RIAA, along with several of its partners, have infringed upon an Altnet patent specifically associated with the identification of requested files over a P-to-P network.

Original Text: ASEAN eyes European model Vientiane (AsiaNews/Agencies) - This morning the Conference of the Association of South-East Asian Nations (ASEAN) opened in Vientiane, Laos.
Translation: ASEAN mira el modelo europeo Vientiane (AsiaNews/Agencias) - Esta mañana se inauguró la Conferencia de la Asociación de Naciones del Sudeste Asiático (ASEAN) en Vientiane, Laos.
Paraphrase 1: 1. Vientiane (AsiaNews/Agencies) - The Association of South-East Asian Nations (ASEAN) Conference inaugurated this morning in Vientiane, Laos, is looking towards the European model.
Paraphrase 2: 2. Vientiane (AsiaNews/Agencies) - Led by the European model, the Conference of the Association of South-East Asian Nations (ASEAN) commenced today in Vientiane, Laos.

Original Text: Poor Medical Treatment Kills Thousands Each Year By MARK SHERMAN    WASHINGTON (AP) -- Requiring doctors and hospitals to report publicly on their performance and tying their pay to the results would dramatically reduce avoidable deaths and costs attributable to poor medical care, says a new report from an organization that works to improve health care quality.    Wild variations in medical care led to 79,000 avoidable deaths and \$1.8 billion in additional medical costs last year, the private National Committee for Quality Assurance said in its annual report released Wednesday...
Translation:
Tratamiento médico deficiente mata a miles cada año, por MARK SHERMAN
WASHINGTON (AP) -- Exigir a los médicos y hospitales que informen públicamente sobre su rendimiento y vincular su pago a los resultados reduciría drásticamente las muertes evitables y los costos atribuibles a la atención médica deficiente, dice un nuevo informe de una organización que trabaja para mejorar la calidad de la atención sanitaria.

Las disparidades en la atención médica provocaron 79,000 muertes evitables y $1.8 mil millones en costos médicos adicionales el año pasado, dijo la Comité Nacional Privado para la Calidad de la Asistencia en su informe anual publicado el miércoles...
Paraphrase 1: 1. According to a recent report by the National Committee for Quality Assurance, making doctors and hospitals publicly accountable for their performance and linking their remuneration to the outcomes could significantly lower unnecessary deaths and expenses linked to substandard medical care. The private committee's annual report disclosed on Wednesday stated that inconsistencies in healthcare resulted in 79,000 needless deaths and an excess of $1.8 billion medical costs last year.
Paraphrase 2: 2. A new report suggests that insisting on public transparency about their performance from doctors and hospitals and connecting their salary to the results could markedly cut down avoidable fatalities and costs due to inferior medical treatment. The annual report by the private National Committee for Quality Assurance, unveiled on Wednesday, disclosed that uneven standards of medical care led to 79,000 preventable deaths and escalated the medical costs by $1.8 billion last year.

Original Text: Murali will take back world record from Warne: Ranatunga (AFP) AFP - Sri Lanka's World Cup-winning skipper Arjuna Ranatunga has congratulated his old foe Shane Warne on becoming the world's highest Test wicket-taker, but predicted his glory will be short-lived.
Translation: Murali recuperará el récord mundial de Warne: Ranatunga (AFP) AFP - El capitán ganador de la Copa del Mundo de Sri Lanka, Arjuna Ranatunga, ha felicitado a su antiguo adversario Shane Warne por convertirse en el jugador con más guickets en pruebas del mundo, pero predijo que su gloria será efímera.
Paraphrase 1: 1. Arjuna Ranatunga, previous World Cup champion for Sri Lanka, commended his past adversary Shane Warne for achieving the title of highest wicket-taker in Test cricket. However, Ranatunga anticipates that Warne's reign will be temporary, expecting Murali to reclaim the world record (AFP).
Paraphrase 2: 2. AFP reports that Arjuna Ranatunga, former World Cup victor for Sri Lanka, extended his congratulations to Shane Warne for becoming the world record holder for most Test wickets. Nonetheless, Ranatunga forecasts a brief period of glory for Warne, suggesting that Murali will soon regain the record.

Original Text: Johnson Takes the Race, While Others Pursue the Cup Kurt Busch set a relatively modest goal for Saturday night #39;s Nascar race at Lowe #39;s Motor Speedway. Forget about winning. On arguably his worst track on the Nextel Cup
Translation: Johnson Gana la Carrera, Mientras Otros Persiguen la Copa: Kurt Busch fijó un objetivo relativamente modesto para la carrera de Nascar del sábado por la noche en el Motor Speedway de Lowe. Olvídense de ganar. En lo que posiblemente es su peor pista en la Copa Nextel.
Paraphrase 1: 1. Kurt Busch had a modest ambition during Saturday evening's Nascar race at Lowe's Motor Speedway, arguably his worst track on the Nextel Cup - he put aside hopes of winning while Johnson led the race and others chased the Cup.
Paraphrase 2: 2. As Johnson emerged triumphant at the Saturday night's Nascar race at Lowe's Motor Speedway, others competed for the Cup. Kurt Busch, on what could arguably be his weakest track on the Nextel Cup, decidedly sidelined any hopes of victory to focus on a more modest objective.

Original Text: Carter out at least two games with Achilles #39; injury) TORONTO Toronto Raptors guard Vince Carter will miss at least two games because of a strained left Achilles #39; tendon. Carter was injured in the second half in last night #39;s 90-to-86 overtime loss at Detroit.
Translation: Carter estará fuera al menos dos partidos por lesión en el tendón de Aquiles #39) TORONTO El base de los Raptors de Toronto, Vince Carter, se perderá al menos dos partidos debido a una distensión en el tendón de Aquiles izquierdo número 39. Carter se lesionó en la segunda mitad del último partido de anoche con una derrota en tiempo extra de 90 a 86 en Detroit.
Paraphrase 1: 1) Due to an injury in his left Achilles' tendon, Vince Carter, the guard for Toronto Raptors, will be unable to play in at least the next two games. Carter got injured during the second half of last night's game against Detroit which resulted in a 90-to-86 loss in overtime.
Paraphrase 2: 2) After incurring a strained left Achilles' tendon injury in the second half of last night's 90-86 overtime loss against Detroit, Toronto Raptors' guard Vince Carter has been declared unfit to participate in a minimum of two upcoming games.

Original Text: News Corp beats estimates Strong sales at newspapers, TV and cable help Rupert Murdoch #39;s media empire post two cents higher. LOS ANGELES (Reuters) - Rupert Murdoch #39;s News Corp.
Translation: News Corp supera las estimaciones Las fuertes ventas en periódicos, televisión y cable ayudan al imperio mediático de Rupert Murdoch a registrar dos centavos más. LOS ÁNGELES (Reuters) - News Corp de Rupert Murdoch.
Paraphrase 1: 1. Rupert Murdoch's media conglomerate, News Corp, surpasses predictions due to outstanding sales in the newspaper, television, and cable sectors, posting an increase of two cents. This news comes from Los Angeles, according to Reuters.
Paraphrase 2: 2. Thanks to robust sales from newspapers, television, and cable, Rupert Murdoch's News Corp has exceeded expectations. The media giant reported earnings that were two cents above estimates, as per Reuters' report from Los Angeles.

Original Text: Kerry Faults Bush for WTO Sanctions Threat Democratic presidential candidate John Kerry on Tuesday accused the Bush administration of failing to protect American jobs from unfair foreign competition after the World
Translation: Kerry Culpa a Bush por Amenaza de Sanciones de la OMC. El candidato demócrata a la presidencia, John Kerry, acusó el martes a la administración de Bush de no proteger los empleos estadounidenses ante la competencia extranjera injusta después del Mundo
Paraphrase 1: 1. On Tuesday, Democratic presidential candidate John Kerry condemned the Bush administration for its failure to safeguard American jobs from inequitable foreign competition, subsequently causing a threat of WTO sanctions.
Paraphrase 2: 2. John Kerry, the Democratic presidential candidate, criticized the Bush administration on Tuesday. He blamed them for not defending U.S. jobs against unjust international competition, thereby resulting in the potential for WTO sanctions.

Original Text: Brazil denies getting nuclear technology from Pakistan The government of Brazil denied Friday that its centrifugal plans for uranium enrichment come from the clandestine nuclear network headed by Pakistani physicist Abdul Q. Khan.
Translation: Brasil niega obtener tecnología nuclear de Pakistán. El gobierno de Brasil negó el viernes que sus planes centrífugos para el enriquecimiento de uranio provengan de la red nuclear clandestina encabezada por el físico paquistaní Abdul Q. Khan.
Paraphrase 1: 1. On Friday, the Brazilian government refuted claims that their uranium enrichment strategies, intended for centrifugal purposes, were sourced from the secret nuclear program led by Pakistani physicist, Abdul Q. Khan.

Original Text: Nationwide predicts house price freeze House prices across the UK will come to a virtual standstill in 2005, the Nationwide Building Society predicted today. The lender said that property prices in Britain look set to rise by just 2 across the year, compared to a rise of 13 in 2004.
Translation: Nationwide predice congelación de precios de viviendas. Se espera que los precios de las viviendas en todo el Reino Unido se estanquen virtualmente en 2005, predijo hoy la Sociedad de Construcción Nationwide. El prestamista dijo que los precios de las propiedades en Gran Bretaña parecen estar listos para subir solo un 2% en el transcurso del año, en comparación con un aumento del 13% en 2004.
Paraphrase 1: 1. Nationwide Building Society forecasted today that UK house prices are predicted to almost stagnate in 2005. The lender pointed out a smaller increase at a rate of 2 throughout the year, contrasting with the 13 growth that was observed in 2004.
Paraphrase 2: 2. According to a prediction made today by the Nationwide Building Society, there will be a negligible increase in house prices throughout the UK in 2005. The lending company contrasted the expected 2 rise to the prior year's 13 increase.

Original Text: Pace for Wireless Number Switches Quickens  WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The number of U.S. wireless  subscribers who are switching providers while keeping their  telephone numbers is accelerating, the Federal Communications  Commission said on Friday.
Translation:
El Ritmo de Cambio de Números Inalámbricos se Acelera
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - El número de suscriptores inalámbricos en los EE.UU. que están cambiando de proveedores mientras mantienen sus números de teléfono está acelerándose, dijo la Comisión Federal de Comunicaciones el viernes.
Paraphrase 1: 1. WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The Federal Communications Commission reported on Friday that an increasing number of U.S. wireless subscribers are changing their service providers but retaining their original phone numbers.
Paraphrase 2: 2. The Federal Communications Commission announced on Friday in WASHINGTON (Reuters) that there is a rising trend of U.S. wireless subscribers who keep their existing telephone numbers while choosing to switch providers.

Original Text: U.K. report cites merits of open-source Open-source software advocates got a potential boost from a report by the U.K.'s Office of Government Commerce, which cited advantages on the server side and a growing maturity on the desktop front.
Translation: El informe del Reino Unido cita los méritos del código abierto. Los defensores del software de código abierto recibieron un posible impulso de un informe de la Oficina de Comercio del Gobierno del Reino Unido, que citó ventajas en el lado del servidor y una creciente madurez en el frente de escritorio.
Paraphrase 1: 1. A report from the U.K.'s Office of Government Commerce, heralding the benefits of open-source software and its growing maturity on desktop platforms, has potentially bolstered the cause of open-source software proponents. This report particularly underscored the advantages open-source software brings to the server side.
Paraphrase 2: 2. Supporters of open-source software could see their cause strengthened by a recent report from the U.K.'s Office of Government Commerce. The report highlights the growing sophistication of open-source programs on desktop environments and underlines the benefits that such software offers for server use.

Original Text: US defeats the EU THE biannual Ryder Cup golf competition in Bulgaria finished with a narrow victory for the US team, which took a lead of three points to beat the European Union team.
Translation: EE.UU. derrota a la UE. La competencia de golf bianual Ryder Cup en Bulgaria concluyó con una victoria ajustada para el equipo de EE.UU., que consiguió una ventaja de tres puntos para vencer al equipo de la Unión Europea.
Paraphrase 1: 1. In the biannual Ryder Cup golf competition held in Bulgaria, the US team came out on top with a slim three-point victory over the European Union team.
Paraphrase 2: 2. The United States team secured a narrow win, leading by three points against the European Union team in the biannual Ryder Cup golf competition, which took place in Bulgaria.

Original Text: Recent American deaths in Iraq As of yesterday, at least 1,206 members of the US military have died since the beginning of the Iraq war in March 2003. Below is a list of those killed recently.
Translation: Muertes recientes de estadounidenses en Irak. Hasta ayer, al menos 1,206 miembros del ejército de los EE.UU. han fallecido desde el inicio de la guerra en Irak en marzo de 2003. A continuación se presenta una lista de los que han sido asesinados recientemente.
Paraphrase 1: 1. As of yesterday, the Iraq war, which began in March 2003, has resulted in the death of at least 1,206 members of the US military. The following is a list of those who have recently lost their lives.
Paraphrase 2: 2. From the onset of the Iraq war in March 2003 until yesterday, the conflict has caused a minimum of 1,206 American military fatalities. A list of those recently killed is provided below.

Original Text: The Swingers (U.S. News   World Report) U.S. News   World Report - The baseball metaphor seems most apt. George W. Bush and John Kerry are like two weary but evenly matched teams heading into the ninth inning of the World Series with the score all tied up. It all comes down to how these boys of summer measure up in the chill winds of autumn.
Translation: Los Swingers (U.S. News World Report) U.S. News World Report - El símil del béisbol parece el más adecuado. George W. Bush y John Kerry son como dos equipos agotados pero igualmente emparejados entrando en la novena entrada de la Serie Mundial con el marcador totalmente empatado. Todo se reduce a cómo estos chicos de verano se miden en los vientos fríos del otoño.
Paraphrase 1: 1. As depicted by U.S. News and World Report, the situation between George W. Bush and John Kerry is akin to two fatigued but equally competent baseball teams entering the last inning of the World Series, with no points difference. Whether they emerge victorious or not depends on their ability to stand up to the chilling shifts of the fall, just like the iconic boys of summer.
Paraphrase 2: 2. Imagine it as if George W. Bush and John Kerry are two baseball teams, tired yet evenly strong, as they step into the final round of the World Series with no clear superiority, just like the portrayal in the U.S. News and World Report. How these metaphorical boys of summer navigate the biting autumn winds will determine the outcome.

Original Text: Zero-gravity jet simulates space for regular folks Space is the one frontier that #39;s out of reach to the average person, but the feeling of space travel is now a little less elusive.
Translation: Un avión de gravedad cero simula el espacio para la gente común. El espacio es la única frontera que está fuera del alcance de la persona promedio, pero la sensación de viajar al espacio ahora es un poco menos esquiva.
Paraphrase 1: 1. The sensation of traversing through space is now somewhat less evasive, thanks to zero-gravity jets that offer a comparable experience for common people. For most people, space has always been a boundary that's beyond their grasp.
Paraphrase 2: 2. The common man can now experience a faint semblance of space travel thanks to zero-gravity jets that emulate the conditions of space. Previously, the realm of space felt out of bounds for the average individual.

Original Text: Four killed in Thai violence SECURITY forces fired shots in the air and used water cannons and tear gas to disperse about 2000 angry Muslim youths rioting in Thailand #39;s troubled south Monday, leaving at least four people dead and more than 20 injured, police said.
Translation: Cuatro muertos en la violencia tailandesa. Las fuerzas de seguridad dispararon al aire y utilizaron cañones de agua y gas lacrimógeno para dispersar a unos 2000 jóvenes musulmanes enfadados que estaban causando disturbios en el sur problemático de Tailandia el lunes, dejando al menos cuatro personas muertas y más de 20 heridas, dijo la policía.
Paraphrase 1: 1. Shots were fired into the air and water cannons and tear gas were deployed by security forces to calm nearly 2000 enraged Muslim teenagers protesting in southern Thailand on Monday. This conflict sadly resulted in a minimum of four fatalities and over 20 injuries, as per police reports.
Paraphrase 2: 2. As stated by the police, the volatile situation in Thailand's disturbed south escalated on Monday, with security forces taking extreme measures such as firing in the air, utilizing water cannons and tear gas. Their target was to scatter a crowd of approximately 2000 irate Muslim youths causing a riot, which unfortunately led to at least four casualties and more than 20 individuals wounded.

Original Text: Intel builds ultrasmall chip in test Intel, the world #39;s biggest semiconductor maker, said on Monday that it had succeeded in building a test chip that packs 10 million transistors into an area the size of the tip of a ball-point pen.
Translation: Intel construye un chip ultrapequeño en prueba. Intel, el fabricante de semiconductores más grande del mundo, dijo el lunes que había tenido éxito en la construcción de un chip de prueba que contiene 10 millones de transistores en un área del tamaño de la punta de un bolígrafo.
Paraphrase 1: 1. On Monday, Intel, the largest semiconductor manufacturer in the world, announced that they have successfully constructed a trial chip that comprises 10 million transistors condensed into the size of a ball-point pen tip.
Paraphrase 2: 2. Intel, recognized as the world's premier semiconductor producer, on Monday reported their success in fabricating a prototype chip which condenses 10 million transistors into a space equivalent to the tip of a ball-point pen.

Original Text: Update 2: Gilead Sciences Stocks Rise Six Percent Biotechnology stocks were trading down marginally Thursday afternoon with the large exception of Gilead Sciences Inc., whose shares were boosted by good results for an HIV treatment.
Translation: Actualización 2: Las acciones de Gilead Sciences aumentan un seis por ciento. Las acciones de biotecnología estuvieron operando marginalmente a la baja el jueves por la tarde, con la gran excepción de Gilead Sciences Inc., cuyas acciones se vieron impulsadas por buenos resultados para un tratamiento del VIH.
Paraphrase 1: Revision 2: Stocks of Gilead Sciences Surge by 6% Despite a slight downturn in biotech stocks this Thursday, Gilead Sciences Inc. stands out with a significant increase in its share price, fueled by the successful outcomes of their HIV medication.
Paraphrase 2: Second Update: Gilead Sciences Inc. Experiences a 6% Increase in Stock Value Amidst a general decline in biotechnology stocks on Thursday, Gilead Sciences Inc. emerges as a notable exception, witnessing a rise in its shares due to positive results from their HIV treatment research.

Original Text: Profit-taking pushes oil prices downward Oil prices fell sharply yesterday in what traders described as a wave of profit-taking after futures hit a new high above \$55 a barrel and after gasoline futures fell sharply on indications of declining demand.
Translation: La toma de beneficios empuja los precios del petróleo a la baja. Los precios del petróleo cayeron drásticamente ayer, en lo que los comerciantes describieron como una ola de toma de beneficios después de que los futuros alcanzaran un nuevo máximo por encima de los \$55 por barril y después de que los futuros de la gasolina cayeran drásticamente ante indicaciones de una demanda decreciente.
Paraphrase 1: 1. Oil prices plummeted significantly yesterday, which traders attributed to an episode of profit-taking subsequent to futures hitting a record high of over $55 per barrel. This drop was also influenced by a noticeable decline in demand, demonstrated by the steep fall in gasoline futures.
Paraphrase 2: 2. Following the surge of futures above $55 a barrel, traders reported a wave of profit-taking which sent oil prices downwards yesterday. This downfall got more traction after a considerable reduction in demand as reflected in rapidly falling gasoline futures.

Original Text: Pentagon exaggerated risk posed by Iraq: US senator (AFP) AFP - A senior Democratic senator released a report alleging that the US Pentagon exaggerated the military risks posed by Iraq before the US-led war there to support a decision already taken by the White House to invade the country.
Translation: El Pentágono exageró el riesgo que suponía Iraq: senador de EE.UU. (AFP) AFP - Un destacado senador demócrata publicó un informe alegando que el Pentágono de EE.UU. exageró los riesgos militares que suponía Iraq antes de la guerra liderada por EE.UU. en ese país para respaldar una decisión ya tomada por la Casa Blanca para invadir el país.
Paraphrase 1: 1. AFP - According to a report published by a senior Democratic senator, the Pentagon inflated the perceived military threats from Iraq to back the decision for invasion, a decision already made by the White House prior to the US-led war.
Paraphrase 2: 2. AFP - A leading Democratic senator has divulged a report suggesting that the US Pentagon overstated the dangers presented by Iraq to justify a pre-decided invasion initiated by the White House, ahead of the US-led war there.

Original Text: Confessions of a British diplomat Should an ambassador speak out over human rights even if this upsets his or her own government? The question has been posed by the dismissal from his post as British ambassador to Uzbekistan
Translation: Confesiones de un diplomático británico ¿Debería un embajador hablar sobre los derechos humanos incluso si esto molesta a su propio gobierno? La pregunta ha sido planteada por el despido de su puesto como embajador británico en Uzbekistán
Paraphrase 1: 1. Should a diplomat, even when British, voice concerns about human rights, risking the displeasure of their own administration? This issue has arisen following the termination of the UK ambassador to Uzbekistan.
Paraphrase 2: 2. The query of whether an ambassador should express their views on human rights, potentially displeasing their home government, is brought forward by the dismissal of a British diplomat from his position in Uzbekistan.

Original Text: Pakistan and India to continue dialogue on Kashmir: Kasuri NEW DELHI: Foreign Minister Khurshid Mehmood Kasuri said that although the Kashmir dispute was central to the peace process it could not be resolved overnight.
Translation: Pakistán e India continuarán el diálogo sobre Cachemira: Kasuri NUEVA DELHI: El Ministro de Relaciones Exteriores, Khurshid Mehmood Kasuri, dijo que aunque la disputa de Cachemira es central en el proceso de paz, no se puede resolver de la noche a la mañana.
Paraphrase 1: 1. Foreign Minister Khurshid Mehmood Kasuri stated in New Delhi that even though the Kashmir conflict is essential to the peace process between Pakistan and India, its resolution won't be immediate, insisting on continued dialogue.
Paraphrase 2: 2. Speaking in New Delhi, Khurshid Mehmood Kasuri, Foreign Minister of Pakistan, acknowledged that the issue of Kashmir is pivotal to peace negotiations with India but warned that it won't be settled quickly, advocating for sustained dialogue.

Original Text: Lewis leads Sonics to ninth consecutive win By wire services. Rashard Lewis scored 27 points and Ray Allen had 24 to lead the Sonics to their ninth straight victory, 101-94 over the Toronto Raptors on Friday night.
Translation: Lewis guía a los Sonics a su novena victoria consecutiva por servicios de cable. Rashard Lewis anotó 27 puntos y Ray Allen aportó 24 para llevar a los Sonics a su novena victoria seguida, 101-94 sobre los Toronto Raptors el viernes por la noche.
Paraphrase 1: 1. Rashard Lewis and Ray Allen, with 27 and 24 points respectively, guided Sonics to their ninth victory in a row, defeating the Toronto Raptors with a score of 101-94 on Friday night, as reported by wire services.
Paraphrase 2: 2. With Rashard Lewis' 27 points and Ray Allen's 24, the Sonics triumphed over the Toronto Raptors 101-94, marking their ninth consecutive win, according to wire services. This historical game took place on Friday night.

Original Text: Yahoo Extends Microsoft Ad Deal  NEW YORK (Reuters) - Yahoo Inc. has agreed to extend its  deal to place advertisements on Microsoft Corp.'s MSN sites in  the United States and overseas by one year through June 2006,  Yahoo said on Thursday.
Translation: Yahoo Extiende Acuerdo Publicitario con Microsoft  NUEVA YORK (Reuters) - Yahoo Inc. ha acordado extender su trato para colocar anuncios en los sitios de MSN de Microsoft Corp. en los Estados Unidos y en el extranjero por un año más, hasta junio de 2006, dijo Yahoo el jueves.
Paraphrase 1: 1. Yahoo Inc. confirmed on Thursday that it has prolonged its agreement to display ads on Microsoft Corp.'s MSN websites in the US and abroad, extending the deal to June 2006.
Paraphrase 2: 2. Through to June 2006, Yahoo Inc. has chosen to extend its advertisement placement agreement on Microsoft Corp.'s MSN platforms in both the United States and other countries, as confirmed by Yahoo on Thursday.

Original Text: Dutch Find Greater Threat to Humans from Bird Flu (Reuters) Reuters - Dutch scientists have determined bird\flu can spread more easily among humans than was previously\thought, researchers said Tuesday.
Translation: Los holandeses encuentran una mayor amenaza para los humanos por la gripe aviar (Reuters) Reuters - Científicos holandeses han determinado que la gripe aviar puede propagarse más fácilmente entre los humanos de lo que se pensaba anteriormente, dijeron los investigadores el martes.
Paraphrase 1: 1. (Reuters) - According to researchers on Tuesday, Dutch scientists have established that the transmission of bird flu among humans is more feasible than earlier believed.
Paraphrase 2: 2. Dutch researchers confirmed on Tuesday that bird flu can infect humans more readily than initially presumed, reported Reuters.

Original Text: Israeli Troops Kill 2 Palestinians in South Gaza (Reuters) Reuters - Israeli troops killed a Palestinian on his\way to a mosque in a Gaza refugee camp on Wednesday as well as\a gunman closing in on an army outpost in a nearby buffer zone,\witnesses and militants said.
Translation: Tropas Israelíes Matan a 2 Palestinos en el Sur de Gaza (Reuters) Reuters - Las tropas israelíes mataron a un palestino en su camino a una mezquita en un campo de refugiados de Gaza el miércoles, así como a un pistolero que se acercaba a un puesto militar en una zona de amortiguamiento cercana, dijeron testigos y militantes.
Paraphrase 1: 1) (Reuters) - Witnesses and militants reported that in South Gaza, Israeli soldiers ended the lives of two Palestinians; one on his journey to a mosque within a refugee camp and another assailant approaching a nearby army base.
Paraphrase 2: 2) According to Reuters, one Palestinian was killed by Israeli armed forces while navigating to a Gaza camp mosque, and another, an armed individual nearing a nearby military outpost. Militants and eyewitnesses in South Gaza confirmed these incidents.

Original Text: Angels Rough Up Loaiza in Win Over Yanks (AP) AP - Jose Guillen and Jeff DaVanon homer off Esteban Loaiza, who failed to make it out of the fourth inning Saturday, as the Anaheim Angels defeated the New York Yankees 6-1 in a storm-interrupted game.
Translation: Los Ángeles Maltratan a Loaiza en Victoria Sobre los Yankees (AP) AP - Jose Guillen y Jeff DaVanon pegan homerun a Esteban Loaiza, quien no logró pasar de la cuarta entrada el sábado, mientras que los Angeles de Anaheim vencieron a los Yankees de Nueva York 6-1 en un juego interrumpido por la tormenta.
Paraphrase 1: 1. In a game disrupted by a storm, the Anaheim Angels triumphed over the New York Yankees with a score of 6-1; Jose Guillen and Jeff DaVanon made home runs off Esteban Loaiza, who was unable to last past the fourth inning on Saturday (AP).
Paraphrase 2: 2. Jose Guillen and Jeff DaVanon scored home runs against Esteban Loaiza contributing to Anaheim Angels' victory over the New York Yankees by 6-1 in a game that was paused due to stormy weather; Notably, Loaiza couldn't hold on past the fourth inning (AP).

Original Text: HEADLINE STOCKS: Stocks to Watch, Nov. 24  NEW YORK (Reuters) - U.S. stocks to watch on Wednesday  include H R Block Inc., Michaels Stores Inc., Tech Data Corp.,  and Microsoft Corp.
Translation: TITULARES DE ACCIONES: Acciones para Observar, 24 de Noviembre. NUEVA YORK (Reuters) - Las acciones estadounidenses a observar el miércoles incluyen H R Block Inc., Michaels Stores Inc., Tech Data Corp., y Microsoft Corp.
Paraphrase 1: 1. HEADLINE SHARES: Nov. 24 Stocks on the Radar  NEW YORK (Reuters) - The US stocks garnering attention this Wednesday include H R Block Inc., Michaels Stores Inc., Tech Data Corp., and Microsoft Corp.
Paraphrase 2: 2. HEADLINE STOCKS: Highlight Stocks for Nov. 24  NEW YORK (Reuters) - The focus for U.S. stocks this Wednesday includes H R Block Inc., Michaels Stores Inc., Tech Data Corp., and Microsoft Corp.

Original Text: BUTTON TO DISCOVER FUTURE Jenson Button will tomorrow discover whether he is allowed to quit BAR and move to Williams for 2005. The Englishman has signed contracts with both teams but prefers a switch to Williams, where he began his Formula One career in 2000.
Translation: BOTÓN PARA DESCUBRIR EL FUTURO. Jenson Button descubrirá mañana si se le permite abandonar BAR y trasladarse a Williams para 2005. El inglés ha firmado contratos con ambos equipos pero prefiere un cambio a Williams, donde comenzó su carrera en la Fórmula Uno en 2000.
Paraphrase 1: 1. Jenson Button will find out tomorrow if he's permitted to leave BAR and join Williams for 2005. The English racer has inked agreements with both teams, yet he fancies a transition to Williams, the team where he kick-started his Formula One career in 2000.
Paraphrase 2: 2. Tomorrow, Jenson Button will receive confirmation on whether he can exit BAR and transition to Williams for the 2005 season. The British driver has committed to both teams through contracts, but his preference lies with Williams, where his Formula One journey commenced in 2000.

Original Text: India Could Consider Pakistan #39;s Kashmir Proposals India could consider Pakistani suggestions for resolving the Kashmir dispute if they are made formally, Foreign Minister Natwar Singh said on Saturday after Delhi announced it was scaling back its forces in the region.
Translation: India podría considerar las propuestas de Pakistán sobre Cachemira. India podría considerar las sugerencias paquistaníes para resolver la disputa de Cachemira si se formalizan, dijo el sábado el Ministro de Relaciones Exteriores Natwar Singh, después de que Delhi anunciara que estaba reduciendo sus fuerzas en la región.
Paraphrase 1: 1. If Pakistan formally submits its proposals for resolving the Kashmir conflict, India is open to consideration, stated Foreign Minister Natwar Singh on Saturday. This followed Delhi's announcement of reducing its military presence in the disputed area.
Paraphrase 2: 2. Natwar Singh, the Foreign Minister, expressed on Saturday that India might take into account the formal proposals provided by Pakistan to resolve the Kashmir issue. This statement came after Delhi declared its decision to scale down their forces in the region.

Original Text: The check #39;s in the syringe The New York Yankees, who make enough money to know better, want the rest of Jason Giambi #39;s contract voided because he admitted to using what can fairly be called a cornucopia of pharmaceuticals.
Translation: El cheque #39 está en la jeringa. Los New York Yankees, quienes ganan suficiente dinero como para saber mejor, quieren anular el resto del contrato de Jason Giambi #39 porque admitió haber usado lo que se puede llamar justamente una cornucopia de productos farmacéuticos.
Paraphrase 1: 1. The New York Yankees, with their capacity to know better given the money they make, are keen on repudiating the remainder of Jason Giambi's contract because he confessed to using a plethora of drugs, which can be appropriately described as a 'cornucopia of pharmaceuticals'. The check is in the syringe.
Paraphrase 2: 2. Despite their wealth, suggesting they should know better, the New York Yankees aspire to annul the rest of Jason Giambi's contract. This comes after his admission to using a wide assortment of pharmaceuticals, an aptly named 'cornucopia'. The check in this context can be found in the syringe.

Original Text: American Express to Replace Auditor (Reuters) Reuters - American Express Co.  said on\Wednesday that it will replace Ernst   Young LLP with\PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as its independent registered public\accountant.
Translation: Traducción al español: American Express Reemplazará a su Auditor (Reuters) Reuters - American Express Co. anunció el miércoles que reemplazará a Ernst Young LLP con PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP como su contador público registrado independiente.
Paraphrase 1: 1. American Express Co. announced on Wednesday that they will be substituting Ernst Young LLP with PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP for the position of their independent registered public accountant, according to Reuters.
Paraphrase 2: 2. According to Reuters, Ernst Young LLP is set to be replaced by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the independent registered public accountant for American Express Co. as stated on Wednesday.

Original Text: Scientists to Study N.Y. Organic Farmers (AP) AP - Cornell researchers will watch five upstate New York dairy herds to learn about the problems and challenges of converting from conventional to organic farming.
Translation: Científicos Estudiarán a Agricultores Orgánicos de N.Y. (AP) AP - Investigadores de Cornell observarán cinco rebaños de lácteos en el norte del estado de Nueva York para aprender sobre los problemas y desafíos de la conversión de la agricultura convencional a la orgánica.
Paraphrase 1: 1. (AP) Cornell scientists are set to study five dairy herds in upstate New York in order to understand the issues and challenges faced when transitioning from conventional to organic farming.
Paraphrase 2: 2. In an effort to understand the difficulties and trials of transitioning from traditional to organic farming, researchers from Cornell will be observing five dairy herds in upstate New York. (AP)

Original Text: Nine Marines dead, deadly explosion rips Baghdad NEAR FALLUJAH, Iraq - Nine Marines killed in Iraq Saturday, eight of them in a car-bombing near Fallujah. That #39;s the heaviest toll on American fighters in about six months.
Translation: Nueve marines muertos, una mortal explosión azota Bagdad CERCA DE FALLUJAH, Irak - Nueve marines asesinados en Irak el sábado, ocho de ellos en un coche-bomba cerca de Fallujah. Esa es la mayor pérdida de combatientes estadounidenses en aproximadamente seis meses.
Paraphrase 1: 1. Tragically, nine marines were killed in Iraq this Saturday, with eight of them losing their lives in a devastating car-bomb attack near Fallujah, Baghdad. This incident signifies the highest casualty rate for American soldiers in approximately half a year.
Paraphrase 2: 2. A lethal blast in the area close to Fallujah, Baghdad resulted in the death of nine marines this Saturday, eight of them perishing in a car bomb incident. This marks the most significant number of American combatant fatalities recorded in the past six months.

Original Text: Palm Introduces a Memory-Packed Organizer (AP) AP - Handheld computer maker PalmOne Inc. unveiled Monday a new memory-packed personal digital assistant that can double as a portable data storage drive.
Translation: Palm Lanza Organizador Repleto de Memoria (AP) AP - El fabricante de computadoras de mano PalmOne Inc. presentó el lunes un nuevo asistente digital personal lleno de memoria que puede funcionar como una unidad de almacenamiento de datos portátil.
Paraphrase 1: 1. (AP) On Monday, PalmOne Inc., a handheld computer manufacturer, launched a new personal digital assistant laden with memory, which can also function as a portable data storage drive.
